Description: Pale green glass finger-ring; cast stirrup-shaped hoop with a flat bezel (cracked); the central part of the hoop is missing; surface irridescence on the bezel.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: Comparable shapes exist in metal (e.g.BM Finger Rings nos 1562, 1626). The shape of the hoop also occurs in metal in the late Classical and Hellenistic periods, but this type (and the associated objects in the tomb) is Roman.
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.84, Tomb 63 no. 1)
